Definition:
Subject of care 
Maturity Level: 0 Draft
Date of the procedure from which the specimen was obtained that allowed the histological diagnosis.
Comments:
Must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Leave empty if not known. Optional rule : Possible date anonymisation by
setting the 15th of every month i.e.: YYYY-MM-15. If the month is not known, we set it to June (06).

Definition:
Age of the patient at the time of the diagnosis.
required if date of diagnosis known
Comments: An integer value > 0. We use the -1 value for unknown. Automatic  calculation from date of birth and date of diagnosis.

Definition: Histology of prymary tumour according to WHO 2017 clasification.
Comments: A value in the WHO 2017 H&N classification list.

Definition: Specifies the histological subgroup
Condition(s): ele-1:All FHIR elements must have a @value or children {hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())}

Definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
Definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
Comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
Requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

Definition: Specifies the histological subgroup for adenocarcinomas

Short: Nasal cavity and paranasal sinuses subsite
Definition: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in nasal cavity and paranasal sinusess
Comments: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

Comments: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

Comments: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

Comments: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

Definition: Describes the result of EBV DNA plasma testing before treatment in NPC type II and III (WHO)
Comments: A string value representing whether the test value was positive, negative or it was untested. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the primer used for EBV DNA plasma testing t in NPC type II and Type III (WHO)
Comments: A string value representing the plasma testing type. Empty if unknown

Definition: Copy number of EBVDNA
Comments: An integer for the number of EBVDNA. Empty if unknown

Definition: Describes the result of HPV tumor testing in oral carcinoma
Comments: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the technique used for HPV tumour testing in orall carcinoma
Comments: A string value representing which was the used technique. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the result of p16 tumour testing in oral carcinoma
Comments: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the result of PDL tumour testing in oral carcinoma
Comments: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the technique used for PDL tumour testing in oral carcinoma
Comments: A string value representing which was the used technique. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Result of PDL1CPS testing, when performed
Comments: An integer for the PDL1CPS test. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Result of PDL1TPS testing, when performed
Comments: An integer for the PDL1TPS test. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describes the result of C reactive protein testing
Comments: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Result of CRP testing, when performed
Comments: An integer for the CRP test. Empty if unknown.

Definition: Describe if the instument is fully compiled or not
Comments: A boolean for the instrument if it was fully compiled or not.
